Pre-Game Insights: Chicago Bulls and Minnesota Timberwolves are set to face off in a non-conference matchup on November 8, 2024.
The Chicago Bulls finished the 2023-24 season with a 39-43 overall record and a 20-21 record at home.
The Minnesota Timberwolves finished the 2023-24 season with a 56-26 overall record, 37-15 in Western Conference play, and 26-15 on the road.
The Bulls shot 47.0% from the field and 35.8% from 3-point range last season.
The Timberwolves shot 48.5% from the field and 38.7% from 3-point range last season.
Injuries for the Bulls include Jalen Smith (day to day, knee), Zach LaVine (day to day, hip), Josh Giddey (day to day, illness), Lonzo Ball (out, wrist), and Patrick Williams (day to day, shoulder).
No injuries are listed for the Timberwolves.
